bioghist.p: Charles Tudor Leber, Jr. (1898-1959) was born in Baltimore, Maryland. He was educated at Johns Hopkins University (A.B 1920) and Princeton Theological Seminary (S.T.B. 1923).

scopecontent.p: These records consist of six notebooks; mimeographed travel letters from Leber in three-ring binders, 1936-1953, 1955 (3 binders, each with a table of contents by place), from India, Germany, Southeast Asia, China, United Kingdom, many to organizational bodies and groups of people ("Dear Friends"); an unfinished manuscript, from 1959 titled "Dynamic for Destiny: The Faith, Courage and Strategy of World Christians"; a publication by Leber titled "War Letters", published by the Board of National Missions, 1941; manuscripts for articles and radio broadcasts by Leber; a portrait photograph of Leber in a frame; and an obituary notice and messages upon Leber's death in 1959.
